item.title: 新风险投资公司 CIV 募集 2 亿美元，押注制造业和能源行业
item.description: 一家名为 CIV 的新风险投资公司已经筹集了 2 亿美元的首期基金，用于投资处理核能和制造业等项目的初创企业；该公司还加入了硅谷支持具有全国影响的物理世界公司的更广泛运动。【原文：A new venture capital firm called CIV has raised an inaugural fund of $200 million to invest in startups tackling projects like nuclear energy and manufacturing — joining a broader movement in Silicon Valley to back physical-world companies with national implications.】

item.title: 特朗普发出威胁后，苹果和 Meta 遭欧盟 7 亿欧元罚款
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普发出严厉报复的警告后，苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：Apple Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc. were hit by relatively modest European Union fines totaling €700 million ($798 million) for violating tough new antitrust rules for Big Tech following warnings of harsh retaliation from US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 马来西亚部长将就关税问题会见美国贸易部长格里尔
item.description: 马来西亚贸易部长扎弗鲁尔-阿齐兹（Zafrul Aziz）将在华盛顿会见美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer），因为这个东南亚国家正在寻求特朗普政府互惠关税的减免。【原文：Malaysia’s Trade Minister Zafrul Aziz will meet US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer in Washington as the Southeast Asian country seeks relief from the Trump administration’s reciprocal tariffs.】

item.title: 关税冲击标普 500 指数，CEO 愁云惨淡堪比金融危机
item.description: 自金融危机以来，美国企业从未在财报电话会议上对经济状况如此悲观，这对投资者来说是一个不祥之兆，他们正试图弄清唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战会给股市带来多大的痛苦。【原文：Not since the financial crisis has Corporate America been so downbeat about the state of the economy in earnings calls, an ominous sign for investors trying to figure out how much more pain Donald Trump’s trade war will inflict on the stock market.】

item.title: 新加坡郭氏民盟年会陷入混乱
item.description: 周三，新加坡首富家族控制的房地产巨头城市发展有限公司（City Developments Ltd.）的一名长期董事会成员，就该开发商与亿万富翁郭氏家族最近发生的不和，抨击了其他董事。【原文：A longtime board member of City Developments Ltd., the property giant controlled by Singapore’s richest family, lashed out at other directors on Wednesday over a recent feud that rocked the developer and the billionaire Kwek clan.】

item.title: 国际能源署（IEA）署长称油价可能因中国经济放缓而进一步下跌
item.description: 国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）负责人表示，今年油价可能会进一步下跌，因为新的产量激增，而需求仍受到中国增长乏力的限制。【原文：Oil prices may decline further this year as new production swells and demand remains capped by China’s faltering growth, the head of the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: 华盛顿特区的特殊地位因性别平等办公室削减工作岗位和成本而受到影响
item.description:
美国首都通常经济平稳，就业稳定。埃隆-马斯克的成本削减运动正在引发前所未有的动荡。【原文：

item.title: 投资组合经理认为加拿大股市是长期赢家
item.description: 投资组合经理们认为，随着唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战持续进行，加拿大股票的表现有望超过美国股票。【原文：As President Donald Trump’s trade war continues, Canadian equities are poised to outperform their US counterparts, portfolio managers argue.】

item.title: 阿达尼机场部门向全球银行寻求 7.5 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，阿达尼集团正在与一些国际贷款机构洽谈为其机场部门提供高达 7.5 亿美元的离岸贷款。【原文：Adani Group is in talks with a group of international lenders for an offshore loan for as much as $750 million for its airport unit, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 机器人制造商 Fanuc 就关税不确定性暂不发布指导意见
item.description: 日本机器人制造商发那科公司（Fanuc Corp.）没有给出全年利润预测，称需要评估美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关税的后果及其对全球经济的影响。【原文：Japanese robot maker Fanuc Corp. refrained from giving a full-year profit forecast, saying it needs to assess the fallout from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs and their impact on the global economy.】

item.title: 中国投资者罕见抛售 20 亿美元港股
item.description: 中国投资者周三抛售了接近创纪录数量的香港股市，在贸易紧张局势缓解的希望刺激香港股市出现缓解性反弹后减持了香港股市。【原文：Chinese investors sold a near-record amount of Hong Kong stocks on Wednesday, reducing holdings after hopes of easing in trade tension spurred a relief rally.】

item.title: 全球风险加剧，中国意外恢复力助铜价上涨
item.description: 尽管受到美国主导的贸易战和中国房地产危机的影响，但今年中国主要市场的铜需求表现出了惊人的韧性，买家利用价格下滑的机会抢购供应，市场指标显示铜需求状况依然稳健。【原文：Copper demand in leading market China has proved remarkably resilient this year despite headwinds from the US-led trade war and the nation’s property crisis, with buyers taking advantage of price slumps to snap up supplies and market metrics pointing to still-solid conditions.】

item.title: 关税冲击订单，英国私营部门萎缩幅度创 2022 年以来之最
item.description: 一项受到密切关注的调查显示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的美国关税导致国外订单枯竭并引发经济衰退担忧之后，英国私营部门出现了两年多来最大的萎缩。【原文：Britain’s private sector suffered its biggest contraction in more than two years after Donald Trump’s US tariffs caused orders from abroad to dry up and triggered recession fears, according to a closely watched survey.】

item.title: 英国长期债券反弹，货币管理组织将销售额降至历史最低点
item.description: 英国进一步减少了长期债券的销售计划，舒缓了投资者对债务需求的担忧，并有可能降低国家的借贷成本，此后英国长期债券大涨。【原文：UK long-dated bonds rallied after the nation reduced planned sales of such securities even further, soothing investor concerns over demand for the debt and potentially lowering the nation’s borrowing costs.】

item.title: 南非通胀率降至近五年低点
item.description: 3 月份，南非通胀放缓至近五年来的最低点，低于央行目标区间的下限。【原文：South African inflation slowed to an almost five-year low in March, taking it below the floor of the central bank’s target range.】

item.title: 欧洲央行预测今年年底工资增长将大幅放缓
item.description: 欧洲中央银行对未来薪资增长的主要衡量指标继续显示，2025 年的薪资增长将大幅放缓，这支撑了对通胀进一步回落的预期，从而可能允许更多的降息。【原文：The European Central Bank’s main gauge of future pay growth continued to indicate a sharp slowdown in 2025, underpinning expectations for a further retreat in inflation that may allow more interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 贸易困境打击服务业，欧元区商业活动停滞不前
item.description: 由于关税的不确定性使服务业的信心降至近五年来的最低点，欧元区私营部门的活动在 4 月份几乎没有增长。【原文：Private-sector activity in the euro area barely grew in April as tariff uncertainty sent confidence in the services industry to an almost five-year low.】

item.title: 印尼维持关键利率以支持印尼盾，并将继续进行干预
item.description: 印尼央行维持其关键利率不变，在全球贸易战不断恶化的情况下延长了其宽松周期的暂停，以稳定货币。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank maintained its key interest rate, extending a pause in its easing cycle to stabilize the currency in the face of a worsening global trade war.】

item.title: 葡萄牙将要求欧盟对国防开支使用例外条款
item.description: 葡萄牙将要求欧盟委员会使用一项例外条款，允许欧盟财政规则的例外情况，以便各国能够适应国防开支的增加。【原文：Portugal will ask the European Commission to use an escape clause allowing an exception to the European Union’s fiscal rules so that countries can accommodate an increase in defense spending.】

item.title: 德国私营部门受关税影响陷入萎缩
item.description: 由于对关税的担忧引发服务业活动急剧下降，德国私营部门四个月来首次出现意外萎缩。【原文：Germany’s private sector unexpectedly shrank for the first time in four months as concerns over tariffs triggered a sharp drop in services activity.】

item.title: 瑞银中国基金称避开电动汽车股转向 "避风港 "消费类股
item.description: 在关税冲突持续不断的背景下，一位绩优中国股市资深人士押注具有避风港特征的消费类股票将跑赢大盘。【原文：A top-performing Chinese equities veteran is betting on consumer stocks with haven characteristics to outperform amid ongoing tariff conflicts.】

item.title: 韩华债券结束亚洲（中国除外）多年来最长交易荒
item.description: 韩国韩华集团（Hanwha Group）旗下的一家公司周三开始发售美元债券，结束了本月除中国以外的亚洲新兴国家以美元发债的空白期。【原文：A unit of South Korea’s Hanwha Group started marketing a dollar bond Wednesday, ending a dry spell in debt offerings this month in the US currency from emerging Asia excluding China.】

item.title: 英国预算赤字超预期，关税来袭前已然如此
item.description: 就在上个月，英国政府借贷超过了官方预测，凸显了公共财政的脆弱状态，甚至在美国关税令经济前景黯淡之前。【原文：UK government borrowing exceeded official forecasts made just last month, highlighting the fragile state of the public finances even before US tariffs dimmed the economic outlook.】

item.title: 印度 4 月经济活动攀升，最新采购经理人指数显示
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的一项即时调查显示，由于国际商品和服务需求强劲，印度 4 月份的经济活动有所改善。【原文：India’s economic activity improved in April on strong international demand for goods and services, a flash survey by HSBC Holdings Plc showed.】

item.title: BD 报道：美国和南非将于本周举行贸易谈判
item.description: 据《商业日报》（Business Day）报道，在特朗普政府对商品征收关税和外交关系出现裂痕之后，美国和南非将于本周举行首轮双边会谈。【原文：The US and South Africa will hold a first round of bilateral talks this week after the Trump administration imposed tariffs on goods and amid frayed diplomatic ties, Business Day reported.】
